headline: Podcast: Dow Hits New Record After Fed Chair Opens Door for Rate Cut
summary: Traders dialed up bets on a September rate reduction and U.S. stock indexes surged, following Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's remarks. Shares in Intuit, the tax-prep software company, fell 5% after a sales-growth outlook below expectations.

content.title: Podcast: Dow Hits New Record After Fed Chair Opens Door for Rate Cut
content.summary: Traders dialed up bets on a September rate reduction and U.S. stock indexes surged, following Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's remarks. Shares in Intuit, the tax-prep software company, fell 5% after a sales-growth outlook below expectations.

headline: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Index Surges as Expectations of a Rate Cut Climb
summary: The S&P 500 rose 1.5% on Friday, Aug. 22, 2025, as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the central bank could begin trimming interest rates as soon as next month.

content.title: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Index Surges as Expectations of a Rate Cut Climb
content.summary: The S&P 500 rose 1.5% on Friday, Aug. 22, 2025, as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the central bank could begin trimming interest rates as soon as next month.

thumbnail.caption: Michael M. Santiago / Getty Images Many of the top performances in the S&P 500 Friday came from shares of companies that could be poised to benefit as interest rates move lower.

headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Tesla, Carnival, Intuit, Nvidia

headline: Intuit (INTU) Reports Q4 Earnings Growth and Expands US$3,200 Million Buyback Plan
summary: Intuit (INTU) reported robust fourth-quarter earnings on August 21, 2025, with net income of $381 million compared to a $20 million loss the previous year, and announced an increase in its equity buyback authority by $3.2 billion. Despite these positive updates, Intuit's stock saw a 1.81% decrease over the past week. This drop aligns with a 1.6% market decline, suggesting that broader market trends rather than company-specific news likely influenced Intuit's movement. This performance...

headline: Intuit (INTU) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of financial technology platform Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) fell 4.3% in the afternoon session after it issued a disappointing revenue forecast for the upcoming quarter, which overshadowed its strong fourth-quarter results.

content.title: Intuit (INTU) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why

headline: Intuit's Strong Free Cash Flow Results Could Push INTU Stock Higher
summary: Intuit produced strong free cash flow (FCF) for its fiscal year ending July 31. Based on its 32.3% FCF margin, INTU stock could be worth over 19% more in the next 12 months. That makes the stock attractive to value investors.

content.title: Intuit's Strong Free Cash Flow Results Could Push INTU Stock Higher
content.summary: Intuit produced strong free cash flow (FCF) for its fiscal year ending July 31. Based on its 32.3% FCF margin, INTU stock could be worth over 19% more in the next 12 months. That makes the stock attractive to value investors.

headline: Intuit's Q4 revenue jump, weak Q1 outlook: CFO explains
summary: Intuit (INTU) stock is falling after the company issued a first quarter revenue forecast that fell short of Wall Street's expectations. Intuit CFO Sandeep Aujla joins Market Catalysts with Julie Hyman to discuss the company's fourth quarter revenue jump, future "win-win" opportunities, artificial intelligence (AI) integration, and more. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Intuit's Q4 revenue jump, weak Q1 outlook: CFO explains
content.description:
Intuit (INTU) stock is falling after the company issued a first quarter revenue forecast that fell short of Wall Street's expectations. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: INTU Q2 Deep Dive: AI Platform Adoption Drives Growth as Guidance Disappoints
summary: Financial technology platform Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 20.3% year on year to $3.83 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $3.76 billion was less impressive, coming in 1.5% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.75 per share was 3.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: INTU Q2 Deep Dive: AI Platform Adoption Drives Growth as Guidance Disappoints
content.summary: Financial technology platform Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 20.3% year on year to $3.83 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $3.76 billion was less impressive, coming in 1.5% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.75 per share was 3.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
